This is very much like playing your way through a South Park episode, and you'll get to see all kinds of places that will be very familiar to you. If you like South Park, you'll probably like this game.  I found the combat system to be pretty interesting ... I am usually not a fan of 'quick time' events (which are those things where you have to press keys in a certain order to get through a section -- kind of like playing Simon), but South Park does them really well.   You pick your ability or your attack, and then you usually have to do a sequences of buttons or clicks to get the maximum effect of your attack. It is not as annoying as it sounds (or at least I found it to not be annoying -- and I have a very low tolerance of this stuff) and actually adds a good flavor to an otherwise pretty typical classic 'Final Fantasy' style combat system.  The game has a really good length to it; towards the end, I was starting to get a bit tired of it, but when I actually finished it was pretty satisfying.  All in all, I'd say it was surprisingly good and very well made (in South Park style anyway).  BEWARE: This is highly uncensored and there's definitely some parts where you will want ot make sure whomever may be watching over your shoulder is of an appropriate age and mindset to see such things :)

So, after 15 really fast hours, finally I reached the end of this game. Oh, gods, I love this game.  First I have to say is that this is not a game for everyone. If you don't like South Park jokes, RPGs, you have a problem with some themes (like gays, conspiracies, aborts, sex, and your everyday average South Park episode), then THIS IS DEFINITELY NOT YOUR GAME.  I am not a big SP fan, but I know the basics. The fat, the jew, the one who usually dies in every episode... Well, that kind of things. The game is completely full of jokes and references to the episodes, so I am probably missing a lot of them. Anyway, there are a lot of references to other things, like other videogames or politics. Your average SP episode, but in a 15 hour game.  The game is easy, even in the highest difficulty. I only lost a few times, but that was my fault completely for attacking the bosses with only half of my power. The really difficult thing is to obtain some achievements, because some parts have points of no return (for example, some things may finish completely destroyed) and then you can't get all the collectibles.  About the gameplay, Obsidian has done it again: The combat system is RPG-like, but the gameplay is more interactive than your usual RPG game, and is really good.  So, summing up everything: If you don't dislike RPGs, know the SP basics, and you don't mind dirty jokes or hear about some themes people may find disgusting, then this is your game. If not, don't press the green 'Buy' button, you will hate it.

TLDR: If you're a fan of South Park, you'll like this game. Controller Recommended.  Despite a troubled development (THQ closing), Stick of Truth has shown how to make a liscenced game right. Every second of the game makes you feel like you're playing an episode of the show. You could even say this is the closest thing to a second South Park movie if you want to go that far. You're the new kid who's moved into town and your new friends (and Cartman) help you learn the basics of the game. Fans of the show will be treated to references across at least the first 14 seasons of the show, and there are points that even feel like fanservice. Combat follows a Paper Mario like set up, with your partners being one of six SP kids. However unlike Paper Mario the 'action commands' in this case seem a bit more forced. The custom made graphical style means that game always runs in real time, even during cutscenes. Said cutscenes glitch occasionally with either you popping in and out between shots or lip sync being slow. Trey and Matt's involvement is clear from the start, with this being the best lampoon of the RPG genre this decade so far.   Length: 10 Hours  Should you buy this: If you're a fan of South Park, add this to your cart. If not it's a bit of a tougher sell. If you're a fan of RPGs though it's worth a look.  Worth: I would say $15, but most sales I end up seeing this game for less than $8 so wait for that.

This game may very well be the most faithfull adaptation of any show/movie based game . South Park the TSOT is a 2D open world RPG game with rewarding exploration and good sense of humor .  The world of South Park is captured perfectly . There are momentos from each southpark esisode scatered around so if you like me and have been followign South Park from espisode 1 you will get a lot of nostalgia . All of the loveble characters are here voice acted by the creators so its almost like watching a very long South Park episode .You can pretty much access each house or establishment in South Park city that appread in the show and loot it .  There are 4 classes you can play each with uniqe skills and upgrades so game has decent replay value .  Perhaps the most imporant thing is the variety of skills and weapons at your disposal ranging from thrawing crap to using katanas . Combat in game requirs you to constatly hit timed window which makes it more fun than average turn based combat . Unfortunetly game may be a little too easy so I would recommend bumping difficulty to hardcore after level 3 .  I don't know if this game would be enjoyable for someone who haven't seen the show very often but for those people who have its a great tribute to South Park legacy .

I've always been a fan of Soth Park ever since I was a little kid. The over the top lines and jokes that make fun of current events and everything else in the world are great! This game looks exactly like you're in the tv show. You get to create your own character and play through a skyrim meets game of thrones world with all of that southpark humor we know thrown in. Great writing, and all of the companions and characters throughout the game make hilarious comments as you play. I love the combat system, it's turn based but throws in mouse clicks for blocking and extra attacks as well as button mashing and random key pressing for special abilities (keeps the combat kind of fresh rather than just taking a turn). I love the story line as well, it is new and inventive while at the same time making fun of other common story lines in todays games and tv shows. The stick of truth is one of the few games where I actually want to find all the secrets and earn all the achievements where it doesnt feel like a chore or get boring, and it has tons of replayability. My only small dislikes are how short it is for an RPG (roughly 12-15 hours for me) I just wish there could be more or at least a DLC. I also dislike how there are only four classes to choose from. Don't get me wrong I love all four classes and especially the new jew class, but i'd like to see a couple more. In the end this is one of my favorite games and I always come back to it if im in the mood for a good laugh and a quality casual RPG.

This is an entertaining if short and not particularly deep RPG, with combat mechanics similar to what we see in Paper Mario. Definitely an interesting diversion, and should hit all the right notes for Fans of South Park.   If you're not familiar with South Park however, I would say that the game is still entertaining enough and should still be worth your time/money when it is on sale.  Most notable upsides: - Entertaining  Most notable downsides: - Combat and difficulty doesn't feel very delicately tuned, a problem that becomes particularly noticable towards the end (one of my companions was doing so much damage it trivialized all encounters - it also made him straight up better than all the other possible companions). - It is pretty short for a RPG (my hours played is misleading as I left the game running/paused for hours even when I wasn't actively playing it)
If your a fan of Super Mario Rpg Battle System and South Park. You will love this game!

I don't even know where to start. Yes. Yes. And Yes.   Story: Clearly, since it was written by the South Park writers -- it would absolutely be true to form. 10/10 Gameplay: Totally old-school RPG status. Turn-based fighting. And endless maze of forest. Little snickers and nods towards 90's rpgs of yore. 10/10  My only issue when I first bought this game was the fact I got hung up on probably one or two missions because it wasn't clear what you needed to do in order to move on. But you can get past that with a simple google search.

(8.5/10 for southpark superfans, 7/10 for those new to the colorado mountains)  The overall game relies quite heavily on knowledge and appreciation of the source material. Not that you *need* to watch the show to play, but if you don't the lions share of the best jokes and humor will pass right over you.  The overall design is a fairly solid turn based 'japanese style' rpg, but with plenty of south park flavoring and silliniess throughout. The gameplay systems are not bad, but they can be fairly readily exploited by experienced rpg players. For instance, the same basic 2-3 configurations of weapon mods and skil use I stumbled on near the beginning of the game basically carried me right up through the final boss fight.  Expect a solid 8-10 hours, maybe 15 if you really go nuts with the collectables, and there is some moderate replay value if you want to go back and try the other classes and combos.  Really though this is for the true fans, and thats pretty much how it should be evaluated, if you loved the show, pick it up and give it a run through at some point, if you don't like the show, probably a pass.

It's basically Paper Mario by Trey Parker and Matt Stone, which is a great thing. Much like Paper Mario, the combat is simple, but keeps you engaged by requiring timed actions for your abilities to be effective. The only downside I will give the game is that if you have any experience with RPGs or even basic strategy it is very easy to break the combat system, making fights incredibly easy: for example, modifying your armor so your abilities can restore more PP than they use, modifying multi-hit weapons to inflict a status effect that stacks, etc. Luckily, the game is about playing through and enjoying all of the little jokes they threw in, and how you handle combat will not interfere with that. If you're interested enough to be reading the reviews, then you probably enjoy South Park enough that you should get the game. Just remember that they're taking full advantage of everything they can get away with that wouldn't go over so well on television.

I was sceptical of this game when it was first announced. Past South Park games haven't been great and i was initially expecting this to follow suit. However i'm glad to say i was wrong and this is possibly my GOTY so far. It's clear on playing this game that a lot of effort has gone into it and you can see that Matt and Trey (South Parks creators) have had a lot of input. As a big fan of the show i was glad to see the story and just the game in general has the same sort of humour as the show and the game is littered with references to stuff from the tv show.   The best thing about this game is that as an RPG taken on it's own merits it still manages to be a very enjoyable game. You pick from 4 classes at the start (mage,warrior, rogue and jew) and you can level up your abilities as well as getting perks for making certain numbers of friends. You also get many different types of melee and range weapons (you're able to equip one of each at a time) and can find items that add effects to the weapons. There's also a lot of customization for your character so you can change there appearance throughout the game to whatever you like.  The story is well done and is just the usual South Park brilliance with a lot of humour and making fun of gaming tropes. You play the new kid in South Park and find yourself in the middle of a struggle between the rest of the kids as they are playing a fantasy game where Cartman is leader of the human faction and Kyle leads the elves. Any South Park fan will love the story in this game.  The graphics are good as well. It does feel like your in an interactive episode of South Park as the game is animated so similarly to the show.  The Good - Great story and gameplay with that brilliant South Park humour - Loads of side quests and collectables that reference the show - Very original feeling game. Has the standard RPG elements but still manages to make a tired formula feel fresh.  The Bad - This game won't win over people who don't like the tv show  -Some of the tutorials feel a bit overcomplicated or don't seem clear  Overall this game is a must-buy if your a South Park fan.I personally loved it and it's a GOTY contender for me. 9.5/10
